response_parsed.title: Documenting Machine Learning Training Loops with FastAPI in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide demonstrates how to structure and document a machine learning (ML) training loop using the FastAPI framework in Python 3.12+. It provides an organized approach for writing reusable, modular code and well-documented APIs for ML projects.
key_points: Organize your ML project into modular components
Utilize Pydantic models to define data structures
Leverage FastAPI for creating an API that exposes the training loop
Document each function using docstrings and type hints
Leverage FastAPI's OpenAPI generation for easy-to-understand documentation

code_examples.code:
from fastapi import FastAPI, APIRouter
from pydantic import BaseModel

app = FastAPI()
model: Model = APIRouter()
# Define data structures with Pydantic models
class InputData(BaseModel): ...
class OutputData(BaseModel): ...

@app.post('/train')
def train(data: InputData) -> OutputData:
    # Your machine learning training loop goes here

version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required for using the latest features of FastAPI.
Make sure to install the necessary dependencies using pip.
